timeline.message:
[ML] Data frame analytics analysis stats

Adds parsing and indexing of analysis instrumentation stats.
The latest one is also returned from the get-stats API.

Note that we chose to duplicate objects even where they are currently
similar. There are already ideas on how these will diverge in the future
and while the duplication looks ugly at the moment, it is the option
that offers the highest flexibility.

timeline.body:
I wonder if all these should be optional.

Then we have a private `ctor` that contains nullable `boxed` types. It would then `unbox` to zero values and pass to the public `ctor`?

This flexibility will help the hlrc compatibility.
timeline.bodyText:
I wonder if all these should be optional.
Then we have a private ctor that contains nullable boxed types. It would then unbox to zero values and pass to the public ctor?
This flexibility will help the hlrc compatibility.

timeline.body:
```suggestion
            AnalysisStats analysisStats = randomBoolean() ? null : 
                randomFrom(
                    OutlierDetectionStatsTests.createRandom(), 
                    RegressionStatsTests.createRandom(), 
                    ClassificationStatsTests.createRandom());
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
AnalysisStats analysisStats = null;
if (randomBoolean()) {
analysisStats = OutlierDetectionStatsTests.createRandom();
} else if (randomBoolean()) {
analysisStats = RegressionStatsTests.createRandom();
} else {
analysisStats = ClassificationStatsTests.createRandom();
}
AnalysisStats analysisStats = randomBoolean() ? null :
randomFrom(
OutlierDetectionStatsTests.createRandom(),
RegressionStatsTests.createRandom(),
ClassificationStatsTests.createRandom());
timeline.author: benwtrent

public static ConstructingObjectParser<TimingStats, Void> PARSER = new ConstructingObjectParser<>("outlierdetection_timing_stats", true,

+package org.elasticsearch.client.ml.dataframe.stats.outlierdetection;
+
+import org.elasticsearch.common.ParseField;
+import org.elasticsearch.common.unit.TimeValue;
+import org.elasticsearch.common.xcontent.ConstructingObjectParser;
+import org.elasticsearch.common.xcontent.ToXContentObject;
+import org.elasticsearch.common.xcontent.XContentBuilder;
+
+import java.io.IOException;
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+public class TimingStats implements ToXContentObject {
+
+    public static final ParseField ELAPSED_TIME = new ParseField("elapsed_time");
+
+    public static ConstructingObjectParser<TimingStats, Void> PARSER = new ConstructingObjectParser<>("timing_stats", true,

timeline.message: Outlier detection paremeters methods should be just a single method
Make HLRC lenient and add getters

timeline.body: This will return a `List<String>` even if there is just one element. If this is to just be a string we should  `declareString`
